cant make the meeting today due to a conflict, but wanted to drop a quick proof of life and a quick update for the benchmarking and silent payments working groups: novo and i are picking back up the batch validation benchmarking and ill be rebasing the silent payments PRs this week and next. will have more detailed updates next week!
hello bitcoin core developer. I used to install bitcoin core and didn't enter password but when I reinstalled it and restored my wallet, I found that my btc address had password. what should I do?
ping (testing my connection?)
glozow pong

#topic Erlay WG Update (sr_gi, gleb, marcofleon)
I have a quick notice about the build-system
#here
hi
hi
(for after the wg updates)
Any erlay updates or should we move on?

Not much to update on my end this week, I started collecting a small subset of data to answer the question of how to select fanout peers in Erlay, but I ended up switching to collect a much bigger set afterwards, as I feared I may be missing something
The script finished tonight, so I麓ll be processing it today. Hopefully more to update on next week
#topic Kernel WG Update (TheCharlatan)
looking for review on #31382
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31382 | kernel: Flush in ChainstateManager destructor by TheCharlatan 路 Pull Request #31382 路 bitcoin/bitcoin 路 GitHub
otherwise things seem to be moving along, thank you to the reviewers.
#topic Benchmarking WG Update (josie, l0rinc)
#topic Silent Payments WG Update (josie, RubenSomsen)

Just copying josie's message: "quick proof of life and a quick update for the benchmarking and silent payments working groups: novo and i are picking back up the batch validation benchmarking and ill be rebasing the silent payments PRs this week and next. will have more detailed updates next week!"
lmk if anybody has anything to add to those
#topic Cluster Mempool WG Update (sdaftuar, sipa)
also, we're considering a secp256k1 sprint week for silent payments in march; see https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/pull/1519
not much to update from me; i've gotten some comments for sdaftuar about the txgraph code, while he's working on rebasing the full cluster mempool implementation on top, which have been addressed
so the thing to review remains #31363, and waiting for the rebase
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31363 | cluster mempool: introduce TxGraph by sipa 路 Pull Request #31363 路 bitcoin/bitcoin 路 GitHub
Started reviewing. Slowly
as always, happy to answer any questions
#topic MuSig2 WG Update (achow101)
oh, and there is more progress on the research side; new linearization algorithm is starting to look increasingly practical as a drop-in replacement (but not now, plz review txgraph first)
that's it for me
#31242 seems rfm, #31243 is next for review. that's all

From the poll, it seems 16 UTC has won. https://app.rallly.co/invite/k0zyyk2uD3ug
The result is to move to 16:00 UTC
which is 2 hours later than current
let's start with this new time next week
Cool, starting Jan 23 we'll meet at 16 UTC
#topic quick notice about the build-system (cfields)

Just a quick heads-up that hebasto/fanquake/I are working through a few build-system issues that may require changes to the way people build. Mainly related to debug options and build types. The goal is to get any last breaking changes out of the way before v29 branch-off so that nothing has to change for v30. I can give updates at a future meeting if/when any breaking changes have been merged for those who miss the PRs.
thanks cfields!
cfields: what sort of breaking changes?
achow101: mostly what happens when you set -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Foo
i can't imagine it'll be nearly as invasive as the autotools -> cmake switch, and even that was remarkably painless for me, so as far as i'm concerned, carry on and keep up the good work please
achow101: will ping you on the PRs for discussion if you'd like.
cfields: only if it breaks gdb :)
hi
achow101: heh, we're trying to make it easier to get exactly the result you want rather than having to fight to override figure out where to put flags. So that should get better, not worse :)
*override or
hebasto: +1 sipa
Anything else to discuss?
#endmeeting
